@brucucked that might be the theme for another piece of work yes, but think about it for a bit. Remember that they can influence and affect each other. If they were all in one school and one of them goes haywire, they will then cause all the other girls with potentially dangerous abilities to run amok. It would be mayhem at any moment. On the other hand, they are treated well and looked up to because their abilities are special and useful, so instead of being locked up they get a system build around them to support them. That the world in the setting isn't grim or dark helps. I think it makes sense actually, silly as it is.

5/5
As for the art, I really appreciate the detail that went into the paizuri scenes, given that I'm a tit-lover myself. The pages depicting the foursome had so much stimuli that it was so overwhelming, which I guess makes it a perfect way to espress how overwhelmed Suou really felt. I liked P181 because in the middle of the action with Suou banging everyone, you get these funny backgound events of non-horny Yagen embarrasingly pouring her breastmilk into multiple beakers and chibi Kojima doing non-horny Kojima things. P169-P170, as well, for more funny "Kjoima and Yagen helping out" scenes in the middle of the fracking.

All in all, I guess I could say I really like this doujin, considering how it was able to make me get off my ass and actually write paragraphs on this thing.

4/5
But anyway, as for the story itself, I think it is sufficient, and doesn't need a sequel to continue the story of Suou and the girls. Adding more to it would probably require more added drama for more character development or a new setting with a new cast of characters. Because yeah, we're all just here to fap. But I have to admit that this doujin really got me thinking, like how the worldbuilding subverts the usual tropes you would find in a lot of doujins. It just feels so different, having a situation so absurd but still feel so down-to-earth.

Now, though I say it doesn't need a sequel, I wouldn't mind an extra chapter where Suou bangs the transfer student, because more girls with huge tits.

3/5
It could go in reverse, with the girls watching Suou leading his own normal life and possibly getting a girl whom he could go steady with. Or the girls, once realizing that Suou would be exiting their lives, start reflecing on how they feel about him, with varying results. Kotonoha is featured a lot alongside Suou, and they already sound close in-story. Maishiro's a possibility, though it would need more work due to her acting career, which is its own literary can of worms. Kojima would most likely just keep Suou as just a friend, since her heart is clearly for sports, but additional development can be written. Iinuma, Ms. Sexkugeki no Soma, already outwardly expresses her affections to Suou. And Yagen's got the fact that she can call on Suou to help her test out possible medicines, giving her some personal time with him. But of course, this is all just under the realm of fanfiction.

2/5
It probably helps that the girls are legitimate prodigies, whose talents would most likely bring further glory to Japan, thus giving the government an incentive to take this seriously. A bit self-serving, yes, but at least they're making policies that are helping the girls in the end. (Here's looking at you, Dropout and every other doujin with an "increase Japan's pregnancy rate" policy out there.)

The worldbuilding leaves possible room for expansion (like fanfics). One day, there will be medical advances that will enable the girls to lead normal lives without MC Suou's help. He'd end up watching the girls go about their lives and finding their own love, and though jealous, Suou would still be happy, like a father watching his girls be able to lead normal lives without anything holding them back. After all, Suou was never trying to find love when he took the job.

1/5
I like how their explanations for the MC being the only one having sex with them invokes the "Reality Ensues" trope. The other guys in this world are like "Having sex every day as a job will get boring one day." and "I'd rather have sex with a girl I love."

We also have government and medical institutions that are legitimately trying to manage this properly for once. They probably saw cases of girls with Pomegranate Syndrome, made parallels to the Kansen Series, and decided "Nope! Definitely not letting that happen!" They essentially have systems in place which keeps Pomegranate Syndrome while also enabling the afflicted girls to live close-to-normal lives. This includes orienting people close to these girls on how to properly manage the syndrome.
